condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: ESAR has regional evidence and tools to guide gender responsive and adolescent programming

description.narrative: Gender responsive programming in the region continues to improve through processes such as Gender Programme Reviews, the integration of Gender in Country Programme Evaluations, formative research on specific topics such as Menstrual Health and Hygiene or gender norms. The development of tools is largely supported through inputs into guidance developed in HQ to improve programming related to gender and adolescents - for example Gender in Health or Programming for the Second Decade. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of research products and tools produced on gender equitable and adolescent programming
